meanings.definition: To mix or intersperse with something else
meanings.sent1: She interlarded the conversation with jokes to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent2: The chef interlarded the pasta with fresh herbs for added flavor.
meanings.sent3: The teacher interlarded the lesson with funny anecdotes to keep the students engaged.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was interlarded with quotes from famous authors, making it more impactful.
meanings.sent5: The artist interlarded colors in the painting, creating a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To insert between layers of something
meanings.sent1: He interlarded the cake layers with delicious cream for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter interlarded the wood pieces with glue before joining them together.
meanings.sent3: The tailor interlarded the fabric layers with intricate lace for a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist found ancient artifacts interlarded between the rock layers.
meanings.sent5: The gardener interlarded the soil with fertilizer to promote plant growth.

meanings.definition: To embellish or enrich with additional material
meanings.sent1: She interlarded her speech with personal anecdotes to make it more relatable.
meanings.sent2: The author interlarded the novel with historical facts to add depth to the story.
meanings.sent3: The comedian interlarded his jokes with funny sound effects for a comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The musician interlarded the song with beautiful harmonies, enhancing its melody.
meanings.sent5: The designer interlarded the dress with intricate beadwork, making it stunning.
